It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its deciduous nature, with compound leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by woody fruits containing seeds. Varronia fuertesii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
